articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Cambodian King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Cambodian King
Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Norodom Sihamoni, King of Cambodia, on his 57th birthday.
					Kim in the message wished the King good health and happiness and great success in his noble cause for prosperity of the country and expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Cambodia would grow stronger.

articles.title: Italian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Italian Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Massimo Andrea Leggeri, Italian ambassador to the DPRK, Thursday hosted a reception to mark the 10th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Italy and the national day of Italy.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 A staff member of the Italian embassy and Italian guests were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception. 
					
					 On the same day a performance of Italian artistes was given at the music hall of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory on the above-said occasions.

articles.title: Unbreakable DPRK-China Friendship to Last Forever
articles.content:
Unbreakable DPRK-China Friendship to Last Foreve
Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are now immensely pleased with the exciting news of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's unofficial visit to the People's Republic of China.
					 His visit to China this time marked a historic event that strikingly demonstrated that the friendship forged by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries in the bloody battles of the arduous revolutionary struggle and cultivated by them as a common asset is unbreakable and great, indeed, and it is the ever-lasting one which has steadily developed generation after generation.
					
					 The DPRK-China relations have developed into the unprecedentedly particular and solid friendly relations as the two countries are not only geographically close to each other but also firmly linked with each other by the bonds of militant friendship and genuine trust.
					
					 The peoples of the two countries were linked with each other by the unbreakable comradely relations in the course of the struggle against the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The revolutionaries and peoples of the two countries fought shoulder to shoulder during the civil war in China after the defeat of the Japanese imperialists, consolidating the ties of internationalist moral obligation and friendship forged in the bloody anti-Japanese war.
					
					 The party, government and people of China sent their sons and daughters to the Korean front under the banner of "resisting America and aiding Korea, safeguarding the home and defending the motherland" despite a lot of difficulties in the early period of their nation-building when the Korean people were waging the Fatherland Liberation War against the aggression of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 Vast plains, mountains and rivers, streets and villages of the two countries are closely associated with the blood shed by the peoples of the two countries in the fierce and bitter battles and amidst ordeals and stories about heroic feats and beautiful stories about their friendship linked them by their common destiny.
					
					 The tradition of blood-sealed ties and friendly relations between the two countries forged on the front of the class struggle against imperialism has steadily grown stronger on the basis of the particularly comradely trust and revolutionary obligation of the leaders of the two countries.
					
					 The tradition of the DPRK-China friendship provided by President Kim Il Sung together with the leaders of the elder generation of China is being carried forward and developed on a new higher stage thanks to the leaders of the two countries.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited China in June 1983 as his first historic foreign visit. In the new century, too, he repeatedly visited China, performing immortal feats in the annals of DPRK-China friendship.
					
					 The several visits paid by the collective leadership of the new generation of China including Hu Jintao to the DPRK confirmed the unshakable will of the two parties and governments to develop on a higher stage the friendly relations provided by the revolutionary forerunners.
					
					 The DPRK and China have supported each other concerning domestic and foreign policy matters and closely cooperated with each other in their efforts to put them into practice. 
					
					 The Pyongyang event for relaying the torch of the 2008 Beijing Olympics and the events held to mark the "year of DPRK-China friendship" last year on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of DPRK-China diplomatic relations provided a new occasion in injecting vitality into boosting the friendship and exchanges in various fields between the two peoples and developing the bilateral relations.
					
					 The WPK and the Government of the DPRK have made positive efforts to consolidate and develop the DPRK-China friendship which has long-standing historic roots and tradition with the fraternal Chinese people who have sent unreserved support and encouragement to them in their just cause.
					
					 The DPRK-China friendship will steadily grow stronger generation after generation as it was forged in the crucible of the bloody revolutionary struggle on the basis of the common desire and aspiration of the two peoples and stood all sorts of tests and trials of history.

articles.title: Special Dishes of Kaesong Area
articles.content:
Special Dishes of Kaesong Area
Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Kaesong, a time-honored historical and cultural city of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, is famous for many special dishes peculiar to the area.
					Thongil Restaurant located at the foot of Janam Hill is a typical one serving Kaesong food.
					
					Choe Kwang Chol, 53, manager of the restaurant, told KCNA that such dishes as Kaesong sweet rice dish, beef soup with rice, kimchi wrapped in large cabbage leaves, broiled eel and honey cookie are popular among customers.
					
					Insam liquor and Songak liquor are favorite drinks of local people, overseas Koreans and foreign tourists.
					
					Special dishes of the city are also served at restaurants of the folk street and many other public catering establishments in the city.

articles.title: Koryo Insam Liquor Factory
articles.content:
Koryo Insam Liquor Factory
 Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- The Koryo Insam Liquor Factory in Kaesong City, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, produces liquor of various trademarks with Koryo insam (ginseng), a special product of the city.
					 The factory started operation in February Juche 41 (1952) when the Fatherland Liberation War was at its height.
					
					 It began producing liquor of good flavor and high medicinal value with Kaesong Koryo Insam in 1961.
					
					 It, now equipped with up-to-date facilities, uses quality natural water to brew several dozen kinds of insam sul (insam liquor), including Susam Insam Sul, Samno Sul and Insam Soju.
					
					 Some of its products won gold medals at the Leipzig International Fair and other international fairs.
					
					 The factory has introduced new science and technologies into production to improve the quality of its products, while retaining its traditional brewing methods.

articles.title: Koryo Celadon Takes on New Look
articles.content:
Koryo Celadon Takes on New Look
						
Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- The Porcelain Creative Group of the Mansudae Art Studio of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has applied new shapes and patterns to Koryo celadon, a treasure of the country.
					 In an effort to bring Koryo celadon up to date, the group has embossed it with classical patterns and figures in an artistic way, promoting its beautiful and graceful features.
					
					 Its ceramists have harmonized the main characteristics of Koryo celadon -- shape, color and decoration -- with each other and blended in the color of the background with that of painting, adding different and rich decorations to the celadon.
					
					 They have inlaid jaded green celadon with patterns to ensure bright and wonderful colors peculiar to the celadon and put glaze on white and colorful celadon to create marvelous colors.
					
					 The group has also obtained possibilities to make jade-green Koryo celadon with clay abundant in the country.
					
					 Beside animals and plants such as crane and willow, they have created new patterns suitable for modern aesthetic feelings.
					
					 Scores of Koryo celadon and other ceramics created by the group have been recognized as national assets.

articles.title: Chart of Meridian Nerve Points Produced
articles.content:
Chart of Meridian Nerve Points Produced
 Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Researchers at the Academy of Koryo Medicine studied and produced a new chart of meridian nerve points.
					 It is made up of a metal human body model for acupuncture and a color chart of meridian nerve to be used for education and clinical practice. 
					
					 The chart helps put on a scientific basis 14 meridian lines and 361 points of acupuncture applicable to the acupuncture treatment, pursuant to Kyongrak theory, as it specifically marks on the basis of the modern medical principles points of movement, electromyography, electroencephalography, spinal cord, meridian line and nerve bushes, etc. 
					
					 The chart can be widely used by everyone as it has the names of nerves corresponding to points of acupuncture and makes it easy to understand the mutual relations between meridian lines and peripheral nerve, the principle of acupunctural prescription and the international names of points of acupuncture.

articles.title: US Accused of Putting Spurs to Development of New Type Missiles
articles.content:
US Accused of Putting Spurs to Development of New Type Missiles
 Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson Thursday in a signed commentary accuses the United States of putting spurs to the development of new type missiles under the smokescreen of "nuclear disarmament". 
					 The commentary says:
					
					 The U.S. is vociferating about "nuclear disarmament" and "nuclear non-proliferation" these days while advocating the building of "a world without nuclear weapons." This is, however, nothing but a cynical ploy to deceive the world by disguising itself as "an apostle of peace" and "a pioneer in nuclear disarmament".
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the U.S. to increase the number of arsenals of sophisticated arms and equipment including nukes in a bid to hold an unchallenged military edge and mount a preemptive attack on any target any time.
					
					 Herein lie the reactionary nature and danger of the moves desperately stepped up by the U.S. to bolster up strategic offensive weapons including modern nukes behind the curtain of "nuclear disarmament".
					
					 The U.S. scenario to use strategic offensive weapons as conventional ones is arousing great concern among the international community. It is by no means fortuitous that many countries of the world are becoming strongly cautious about the U.S. arms build-up, claiming that no one but the U.S. would know whether its flying intercontinental ballistic missile is fitted with a nuclear warhead or conventional warhead. They contend that there is worry that this may easily trigger off a nuclear war as it is hard to discern its marking. 
					
					 If the U.S. is allowed to continue pursuing its missile development, modernization of nukes and arms-buildup as now, this will throw the world into the vortex of arms race and render the international situation more complicated. 
					
					 With no rhetoric can the U.S. cover up its true colors as the arch criminal escalating the arms race and international tension and seriously threatening and disturbing world peace and security.

articles.title: Hack Writers on Payroll of S. Korean Conservative Slammed
articles.content:
Hack Writers on Payroll of S. Korean Conservative Slammed
 Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Some media of south Korea do not hesitate to talk such rubbish that it is "important to set right the loosened principle toward the north" and "tourism is the job that can be done slowly," in reference to the issue of tour of Mt. Kumgang, while defending the conservative authorities in their moves to escalate the inter-Korean confrontation.
					 Minju Joson Thursday says in a signed commentary in this regard: 
					
					 The above-said outbursts clearly indicate that some media of south Korea have been reduced to the waiting maids of the conservative authorities and trumpeters of confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 Had some media of south Korea not gone the lengths of conducting the anti-DPRK false propaganda so persistently and noisily, the tour of Mt. Kumgang would not have been scuttled nor the inter-Korean relations would have reached such an unpredictably extreme phase.
					
					 The blame for the extremely strained inter-Korean relations including the failure to resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang rests with the hack writers on the payroll of the conservative authorities.
					
					 The "principle toward the north" touted by hack writers of south Korea is nothing but the "principle" of confrontation with fellow countrymen touted by the conservative authorities. 
					
					 The "advise" given by the hack writers to the conservative authorities to "set right the loosened principle toward the north" is, in the final analysis, nothing but a call for escalating the confrontation with fellow countrymen as they have advocated "adherence to the principle."
					
					 This is an unpardonable crime.
					
					 Only a severe judgment of the nation awaits those hack writers hell-bent on falsifying truth in contravention of public mind-set. 
					
					 Media of south Korea would be well advised to draw a lesson from this and honestly repent of their behavior and stop serving the dictatorial forces which seek a way out in escalating the confrontation with fellow countrymen, their backs turned on the nation.

articles.title: Establishment of Peacekeeping Regime on Korean Peninsula Urged
articles.content:
Establishment of Peacekeeping Regime on Korean Peninsula Urged
 Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- It is of an urgent necessity to establish a peace-keeping regime if the confrontation is to be defused on the Korean Peninsula, Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes in a signed commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is the unanimous desire of humankind and the trend of the times to do away with the leftover of the Cold War Era and build a peaceful world.
					
					 It is the Korean people who more ardently desire peace and stability than any others.
					
					 It is the long-cherished desire and aspiration of the Korean nation to free the peninsula from confrontation and war and terminate the division and live in peace in a reunified country.
					
					 But the most acute military confrontation in the world persists on the peninsula.
					
					 Huge U.S. forces are permanently present in south Korea and in its vicinity, watching for a chance to ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK anytime.
					
					 It is thanks to the strong military power of the DPRK that the second Korean war, nuclear war, has not broken out on the peninsula.
					
					 But for the DPRK's powerful war deterrent, the Koreans would have suffered the same war disaster as Iraqis did long ago.
					
					 The Korean people are now building a socialist thriving nation to be proud of before the world despite the persistent politico-military pressure and sanctions of the U.S.-led international reactionary allied forces. 
					
					 The sanctions and military pressure, however, never work on the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should not pay lip-service to the peace and stability on the peninsula but show its will by responding to the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty.

articles.title: "Improving Four Large Rivers" Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
"Improving Four Large Rivers" Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- More than 8,000 Catholics of south Korea held a "mass" in Myongdong Cathedral in Seoul on May 10 in protest against the puppet authorities' moves to push forward the projects for "improving the four large rivers ". 
					 The participants bitterly denounced the authorities for getting frantic in the projects bringing profits to big business men only, remaining utterly indifferent to the people's living. 
					
					 They urged the authorities to stop at once the projects depleting the natural environment which will entail irrevocable damage. 
					
					 They published a declaration of actions against the above-said projects.

articles.title: "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty" Declared Void in S. Korea
articles.content:
"Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty" Declared Void in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- More than 100 intellectuals in south Korea at a press conference in Seoul on May 10 declared the "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty" null and void, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 They in a statement laid bare the injustice of the treaty fabricated by the Japanese imperialists a century ago and declared the treaty null and void.
					
					 It was reported that Japanese intellectuals held a press conference in Tokyo on the same day at which they decided to issue a similar statement.

articles.title: Actions against Tuition-free except Korean Schools Unabated in Japan
articles.content:
Actions against Tuition-free except Korean Schools Unabated
 Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- Korean residents in Japan are carrying on their actions for the settlement of the issue of support for the Korean schools.
					 Koreans in Nishi Kobe and Sumadarumi areas of Hyogo Prefecture conducted information service on April 23 denouncing the Japanese government for its unreasonable discrimination against the Korean schools.
					
					 Members of the Hyogo Prefectural Headquarters of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, teachers of the Korean primary and secondary school in Nishi Kobe and members of the mothers' association in literature condemned the Japanese authorities' unreasonable policy of discrimination against national education.
					
					 Officials and compatriots under the Itami Chapter of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) staged together with Japanese personages of different strata a joint action around Itami Railway Station on April 26 to build public opinion urging the authorities to enforce a policy of supporting the Korean schools without any discrimination.
					
					 Members of the Itami City Assembly involved in the information service held that the interference of politics in the education matter should not be allowed, stressing the need to enforce the policy of support for the Korean schools on an equal basis as it is done for the Japanese schools.

articles.title: Anniversary of Inter-Korean Declaration Observed in Mexico
articles.content:
Anniversary of Inter-Korean Declaration Observed in Mexico
Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar on the idea of national reunification of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and exploits performed by them took place in Mexico on May 5 on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 Attending the seminar were personages of the Mexican National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism and the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea and masses.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, in his report referred to the significance of holding the seminar and briefed the attendants on the undying exploits of the President who provided the great tradition of the great national unity and dedicated his whole life to the cause of national reunification.
					
					 The President's idea of great national unity has been successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il, he said, expressing belief that the Korean people would bring about a new turn in the national reunification movement this significant year marking the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Juan Campos Vega, chairman of the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche idea, and other speakers spoke highly of the validity and vitality of the idea of national reunification set forth by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the great exploits performed by them for the cause of national reunification. They explained and proved the epoch-making changes that have taken place in the movement for national reunification since the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					
					 Kim Il Sung's last instructions for national reunification will surely be implemented under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il, they said, expressing full support and solidarity with the WPK and the people of the DPRK in the efforts to achieve national reunification under the banner of the joint declaration.

articles.title: Es eterna la invencible amistad Corea-China
articles.content:
Es eterna la invencible amistad Corea-China
Pyongyang, 13 de mayo (ATCC) -- Ahora, la noticia emocionante de que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il realizo la visita extraoficial a la Republica Popular China hace bullir al pueblo coreano del jubilo infinito. 
					Esta visita del Dirigente a China deviene un evento historico que manifesto energicamente que la amistad Corea-China, preparada y florecida como la riqueza comun por los veteranos dirigentes de los dos paises en el fragor de la ardua lucha revolucionaria, es la tan solida y grande que no se podra romper con nada y es la eterna que se desarrolla sin cesar de generacion en generacion.
					
					Las relaciones Corea-China han venido desarrollandose como las especiales y firmes de amistad sin precedentes, porque los dos paises estan ligados firmemente no solo en lo geografico sino tambien por la fraternidad combativa y la sincera confianza 
					
					Los pueblos de ambos paises  se unieron por las relaciones camaraderiles en el proceso de la lucha contra el imperialismo japones.
					
					Los revolucionarios y los pueblos de ambos paises consolidaron la obligacion internacionalista y la fraternidad, establecidas en los dias de los sangrientos combates antijaponeses luchando juntos en la guerra nacional iniciada en China despues de la derrota del imperialismo japones.
					
					El partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de China, a pesar de muchas dificultades interpuestas a principios de la fundacion del pais, enviaron a sus hijos e hijas al frente coreano bajo la bandera de la "resistencia a los yanquis, la ayuda a Corea y la defensa del hogar y pais propios" cuando el pueblo coreano desarrollaba la Guerra de la Liberacion de la Patria contra la agresion de imperialistas yanquis.
					
					La  sangre, derramada por los pueblos coreano y chino en las fieras batallas y vicisitudes, esta  impregnada claramente hoy tambien en las llanuras, montes, calles y aldeas de ambos paises y los relatos de proezas heroicas y las historias hermosas surgidos en esos ligaron como uno el destino de los pueblos de ambos paises.
					
					La tradicion de los lazos consanguineos y las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises establecidos en el frente de la lucha antiimperialista y clasista ha venido fortaleciendose de continuo a base de la especial confianza camaraderil y la obligacion revolucionaria de los dirigentes de los dos paises.
					
					La tradicion de la amistad Corea-China, preparada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y los veteranos dirigentes chinos, se lleva adelante hoy en una nueva etapa elevada por los dirigentes de los dos paises. 
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quien visito en junio de 1983 a China como su primer viaje historico al extranjero, realizo en varias ocasiones en el siglo nuevo la visita a este pais vecino registrando imborrables proezas en los anales de la amistad Corea-China. 
					
					El colectivo de direccion de nueva generacion de China incluso Hu Jintao visito en varias ocasiones a nuestro pais. En este curso, se ha confirmado la firme voluntad de los partidos y gobiernos de los dos paises de desarrollar en el nivel mas alto estas relaciones de amistad preparadas por los precursores revolucionarios. 
					
					Corea y China se apoyan en el tratamiento de los problemas de politicas interiores y exteriores y cooperan entre si estrechamente en la lucha por el respecto. 
					
					La carrera de relevos de la antorcha de los Juegos Olimpicos para 2008 en Beijing, efectuada en Pyongyang, y las actividades conmemorativas del "Ano de amistad Corea-China" que se realizaron en el ano pasado con motivo del 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre ambos paises sirvieron de nuevo motivo para fortalecer la amistad entre los pueblos de ambos paises y el intercambio en todos los dominios y dar animo al desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales. 
					
					  El Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hacen ingentes esfuerzos, junto con el hermano pueblo chino que envia el apoyo y solidaridad sinceros a la justa causa de Corea, por consolidar la amistad Corea-China que tiene profunda raiz historica y magnifica tradicion. 
					
					  Se desarrollara generacion tras generacion la amistad Corea-China, que fue establecida en el fragor de la sangrienta lucha revolucionaria y basada en la aspiracion comun de ambos pueblos y supero todas las adversidades de la historia.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia el desarrollo de nuevos misiles de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia el desarrollo de nuevos misiles de EE.UU.
						
Pyongyang, 13 de mayo (ATCC) -- Con respecto a que detras de la cortina de "desarme nuclear", Estados Unidos da acicate al desarrollo de nuevos misiles, el periodico Minju Joson divulgo este jueves un comentario individual que sigue:
					En estos dias, EE.UU. habla con bombo y platillo del "desarme nuclear" y la "no proliferacion nuclear" insistiendo en la construccion de un "mundo sin armas nucleares". Este no pasa de ser un embuste para enganar al mundo pintandose como "angel de la paz" y "precursor de desarme nuclear".
					
					El verdadero intento de este imperio es tomar la supremacia militar absoluta engrosando continuamente su arsenal de armamentos modernos, inclusive los nucleares, y atacar preventivamente con ellos cualquier blanco en cualquier tiempo. He aqui el caracter reaccionario y peligroso del aumento de armas de ataque estrategico, incluyendo las armas nucleares modernas, al que recurre EE.UU. freneticamente detras del vistoso cartel de "desarme nuclear".
					
					El intento del imperio de usar las armas estrategicas como las convencionales suscita gran preocupacion de la sociedad internacional.
					
					Varios paises del mundo estan muy cautelosos del desencadenamiento de la guerra nuclear debido a la dificultad de distinguir de que tipo sera la ojiva del misil balistico intercontinental eventualmente en vuelo. EE.UU. seria el unico que sepa que esa ojiva es la nuclear o la convencional.
					
					Si EE.UU. sigue recurriendo como ahora al desarrollo de misiles, la modernizacion de armas nucleares y el aumento armamentista, el mundo sera empantanado en la carrera armamentista y la situacion internacional se tornara mas complicada.
					
					EE.UU. no podra ocultar con ninguna palabra agradable su naturaleza de autor principal que agrava la carrera armamentista y la tension internacional, amenaza y perturba gravemente la paz y la seguridad del mundo.

articles.title: Minju Joson critica a los medios de prensa surcoreanos
articles.content:
Minju Joson critica a los medios de prensa surcoreanos
Pyongyang, 13 de mayo (ATCC) -- En cuanto al problema del turismo al monte Kumgang, algunos medios de prensa del Sur de Corea publican sin escrupulos en sus planos unos disparates como "el asunto importante de ahora es hacer rigido el principio sobre el Norte que se vio aflojado" y "el turismo es un asunto en que no hay necesidad de apurarse". 
					Estas versiones, que defienden las maniobras de las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas en busca de la confrontacion fratricida entre ambas partes coreanas, muestran claramente que esos medios de prensa se han convertido en los sirvientes de las autoridades conservadoras y en los trompeteros de la campana lanzada por estas por la confrontacion fratricida. 
					
					Revela asi el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este jueves y prosigue: 
					
					Tal vez el turismo al monte Kumgang no habria sido interrumpido y las relaciones intercoreanas tampoco habrian llegado como ahora al extremo de imprevisible desenlace, si no se hubiera librado esa campana mediatica anti-RPDC tan obstinada y perversa. 
					
					La responsabilidad del empeoramiento extremado de las relaciones Norte-Sur, incluso el turismo al monte Kumgang, recae tambien sobre los periodistas venales seguidores de las autoridades conservadoras. 
					
					El "principio sobre el Norte" aludido por esos plumiferos es el de confrontacion fratricida presentado por las autoridades conservadoras. 
					
					Entonces, la exigencia de los primeros a las segundas, quienes vinieron abogando por el supuesto "mantenimiento del principio", de que "hagan rigido el aflojado principio sobre el Norte", da lo mismo que demandar que intensifiquen mas que ahora las maniobras de confrontacion fratricida. 
					
					Esto es un crimen nunca perdonable. 
					
					A los plumiferos, que tergiversan la verdad nadando a contrapelo de la opinion publica, les espera la severa sentencia de la nacion coreana. 
					
					  El circulo de prensa del Sur de Corea debe sacar leccion y reflexionar con sinceridad de ello y dejar de servir como lacayo del poder dictatorial que busca la salvacion en el enfrentamiento fratricida dando espaldas a la nacion.

articles.title: Platos famosos de Kaesong
articles.content:
Platos famosos de Kaesong
Pyongyang, 13 de mayo (ATCC) -- Kaesong es la ciudad coreana ampliamente conocida no solo por su larga historia y cultura sino tambien por sus platos originales y exquisitos.
					  El Restaurante Thongil situado al pie del monte Janam es el representativo que cocina mejor los platos locales de Kaesong.
					
					  En entrevista con la Agencia Telegrafica Central de Corea, el gerente Choe Kwang Chol (de 53 anos de edad) dijo que estan entre las preferencias de la clientela las comidas tradicionales que se expenden en su restaurante, tales como yakbap de Kaesong (arroz glutinoso cocido y condimentado con azucar, datil, castana, pinon y aceite de sesamo), la sopa de visceras de res, kimchi envuelto en hojas de acelga, la anguila asada, la pastilla hecha con harina, miel y otros ingredientes, nochi (una especie de pastel de arroz), etc.
					
					  Sobre todo, los clientes nacionales, incluyendo los residentes en ultramar, y extranjeros piden mucho el licor de Insam, el aguardiente Songak y la carne asada llamada Solyajok, orgullos de Kaesong, apunto.
					
					  Varias comidas cocinadas aqui y el servicio amable dejan profundamente impresionados a los huespedes, concluyo.
					
					  Ademas de este restaurante, muchas unidades de servicio gastronomico como los comedores de la avenida folklorica son especializadas en los platos especiales de Kaesong y los otros de primera clase.

articles.title: Fabrica de Licores de Insam de Coryo
articles.content:
Fabrica de Licores de Insam de Coryo 
Pyongyang, 13 de mayo (ATCC) -- El licor de Insam es conocido ampliamente en el mundo porque se elaboro con Insam (ginseng) de Coryo, producto especial de la ciudad de Kaesong.
					  Lo produce mucho la Fabrica de Licores de Insam de Coryo en dicha ciudad, fundada en febrero del 41 (1952) de la Era Juche cuando se libraba la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (junio del 1950-julio del 1953).
					
					Ella empezo a hacer desde 1961 los licores sabrosos y de gran eficacia medicinal tomando por ingrediente dicha planta medicinal.
					
					En la actualidad, produce decenas de especies de licores, entre ellos, Susaminsamsul, Samrosul e Insamsoju. Esta dotada con los equipos modernos, y se le suministra el agua natural de buena calidad.
					
					Algunos productos ganaron en varias veces la medalla de oro en la feria Leipzig de Alemania y otras internacionales.
					
					Ahora esta planta de licores introduce activamente nuevas ciencias y tecnicas en la produccion manteniendo el tradicional metodo de destilacion de licores y contribuye al fomento de bienestar del pueblo.
